Kosovo Government announces on the 11th March 2020 preventative measures for education institutions.

The measures, proposed by Koovo Minister of Health Arben Vitia, were approved at a meeting of the government held on Wednesday evening.

description:
Schools in Kosovo reopened on the 14th of September 2020, under a three stage plan.
Stage 1 involves: preschool level and grades 1,2,3,6 and 10 starts teaching on Monday, September 14 with school presence, while grades 4 and 5 start teaching in the same date,  with presence in school, or combined teaching, depending on the capacity of the school in accordance with the assessment of the task force at the level of MED and school.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with no conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

On September 21 Kosovo announces that stage 2 of schools openings can proceed.

description: On 14 March 2020, the government of Kosovo announced that individuals over the age of 16 are prohibited from leaving their homes for more than 90 minutes per day. This effect is in place until 3 May 2020. Other individuals will receive a time slot to leave their homes for 90 minutes based on their ID or passport number. Failure to comply results in a EUR 1000 fine.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)

description: Kosovo’s Prime Minister on March 24th imposes a 16 hour curfew to restrict the movement of all citizens across the country. People in need of emergency medical help, as well as production activities, supply of food and medicine and services, and activities related to the management of coronavirus pandemic are exempt from the curfew.The movement of all citizens across the country is restricted from 10.00 am to 4.00 pm and from 8.00 pm to 6.00 am
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
